content: My long time favorite kanji study app
app is structured well. I feel this is greatly accelerating my studies. only downside is the random crashes after long study sessions.
I need larger text. Even on the largest option I can't make out the questions without glasses. Please when you get chance adjust the range to make larger text.

Just bought the pro version. Even in the free mode, the app is very user-friendly and provides a lot of ways to customize the way you learn the kanji, making it very adaptable to individual learning styles. If you're a self-study language person, this app will probably be your best tool for kanji acquisition.
Bought the pro to support dev since the free version is really good.

One of the only apps that the free version was so helpful I upgraded just because I wanted to support the creator. And I'm glad I did. Love the new customizations and so glad to be able to completely adjust and turn off the hints which i had a hard time not getting distracted by when testing myself but liked it when studying because it helped me commit to memory. Maybe it's nostalgia of being in school but I'd get rid of my social media before this app and would learn any language they put out.

It's a nice upgrade to the free app that I have found very much useful, but for this paid version, I wish it'd pick another sound effect for a wrong answer breaking glass. I find it too startling. UPDATE 1/4/20: The glass sound has been changed to a buzzer, which is much better. Giving back the star I took off for it.

Great app to study Kanji, from recognition to writing! The sounds/speech in the reading section doesn't work when I click the icon even though I have tts with Japanese installed. If this is fixed or given better instructions, it's a 5 star app
The best kanji learning app I've found. Writing feedback is excellent, the information about each kanji is helpful to remember pronunciation and words.

Great for keeping track of your kanji... if you follow the grades in the app. I would like an option to hide pronouncuations which include the kanji itself as my eyes instantly focus on it when trying to remember. Overall a great app that I use everyday.
My favorite Japanese learning app.
It would be better if I could hear what the kanji sounds like. Theres no sound output.

I really like this app, it's great for checking gaps in your knowledge when studying for the JLPT. I haven't been able to figure out how to export my lists to pc yet, but other than that I really can't complain.
Very clear and easy to use. And I love how it teaches you through the grades
Here is where I spend an hour a day
replyContent: I added a button to disable the morphs a few days ago, but forgot to update this review.

content: Just as great as the free version, but just a tad better.

this is THE ONLY Japanese language learning app I have used for more than 6 months consistently. I've tried about 50 kanji learning apps and this one is by far my favorite. it is effective, easy to use, covers everything you ever need to know, and the stroke order is accurate. it even has a customizable dark and light modes for those who like options. I don't usually write reviews for apps, but this one deserves it. it is clear that there was serious time and energy put into this app.

Great app. I like the fact that it gives me feedback in percentage of how much I know. Although I would like to have an option with user lists where I can add my own words or notes, since there are some expressions I was not able to find. Also would be useful to be able to paste in or insert words/kanji from a document.

Used the free version so much that thought the upgrade was worth it. Brilliant dictionary and it has been a great accompaniment to the main methods I use to learn Kanji and Japanese in general. Thank you.
Best app for reviewing and reinforcing vocabulary. とてもありがとうございます ！

Amazing app but gutted to lose history when upgrading to Pro version. Other than that this is absolutely brilliant in every way. Kanji learning that's quick and easy, actual words testing which helps utilise the knowledge of the meanings to support vocabulary learnt

I want to say first I really like this app. The reason I can't give 5 stars is that, as I'm using it to study specific kanjis from my classes, managing study lists is very important. However, I had some issues with that. For example, I can remove words from my lists by clicking the star in the upper right corner, but that star is not there for kanjis. I have to search every kanji in "add words" to remove them individually. Also would love to be able tu use study lists in Recognition and Reading.
Fantastic app. Well worth buying

Would be great to have a feature to learn the radicals, as a complete understanding of these can make it much easier to learn kanji effectively I think, as well as communicate the kanji you are trying to find if you ask a friend or use a Japanese dictionary
I've learned more Kanji in the last 2 days since I got this app than in the last 73 since I started learning Japanese. Not only is it effective, it's fun to use too. Wish I had found it sooner.
I purchased because of the personal user list, but I don't see the button to add words to my own list anywhere? The tutorial doesn't include it either

I usually never buy paid versions of any apps because either the app just isn't good enough or I don't find it worth paying for. kanji tree is the first app I paid for(which is great deal considering its the first app I ever bought).pros,The kanjis are divided using various categories which makes learning the kanji systematically much easier. custom decks helped me in making my own decks out of the words from the text books I was referring. Cons example statements not provided... 😬Good app

Spent so much time with the free one I figured the dev was owed the upgrade, but I get more kanji and also audio readings, too, so we both win. Editing to add that the only thing wrong with this is that the audio for readings is apparently streamed, because 99% of the time it lags awfully, not playing with the reveal of the word and mostly not even playing until the button is tapped repeatedly.
Very helpful. Thank you for making this. :)

Top 3 of my go-to Japanese language apps. It's an effective tool to learn kanji including reading and writing them. I'm glad to support the app developer and upgraded to the pro version. I love how I can practice writing the kanji while learning words that contain that kanji.
Actually phenomenal. I don't actually care about any of the features from the paid version, but I had to buy it to support such a great app.
Love the app. Honestly forgot that I wasnt using the paid version. Only upgraded to pro to support the developer

Lacks user control. Adding a specific kanji to your study list is a huge task. Which is a shame, since the ability to exclude vocabulary for kanji you don't know makes it BY FAR the most effective way I have found to quickly study targeted vocabulary. Edit: Complained before that I could only reset scores all at once, and wanted the ability to reset individual scores. Now I can't reset scores at all without uninstalling. This ability is VERY important, and this has cost you two stars. 4 to 2.
Amazing app. Great for learning and practicing kanji. If the developer(s) ever get a chance, including example sentences for the words would be a nice addition.

How to fix no pronunciation sound... answered! I just download this, love it so far, but no pronunciation sounds were working though I could hear other effects. When getting the pro version it asked which text-to- speech engine, samsung or google. I didn't know, so I selected samsung. That was the source of the problem for me, so pick Google if you can. To fix, go to settings (on your phone, not the app) > accessibility > text-to-speech and there you can select google. Restart kanji tree.

This app is pretty awesome. I started with the free version then after seeing what it could do I decided to purchase the pro. It's totally worth it for all the functionality it gives. It really is a pretty complete language learning app, if you don't need pictures to learn the meaning of words. With the flash card style memorization practice, the impressive dictionary, and the writing practice portions (I'd recommend a stylus), you really get your money's worth.

I really want to enjoy this app... on faith I purchased the pro bc the features sounded nice but the speech feature doesnt work and i cant add some words to personal lists and thats just disappointing. I got the pro mainly bc of the speech feature and its disabled I guess? I havent found any solutions so maybe its a bug.

I love the app, it is a great way to learn and I love how kanjis are organized in different categories. For all the people that complain they can't hear the pronunciation: that's an issue with your phone not with the app. I had the same problem at first, had to go into my phone settings and do some stuff before it could work. The app does explain that however....
I really love the app! It definitely helps me learn a lot faster. Can you please fix the voice buttons, though? I would like to hear the words being pronounced but they don't work.

This app... is super buggy. At 1st, I couldn't log into my email to sync my scores, and the keyboard wasn't working. I managed to fix it with a good old fashioned stop and restart, but speech still doesn't work and I cant add words to my personal study lists, which are the whole reason I got this app! Please tell me how to fix this or something because I waited TWO years to get the pro version after making sure I could really use the regular version and I'm really disappointed :(
The pronunciations aren't working for me. Thank you for the excellent app.
Simple and straightforward. One of the few apps which is actually helping me to learn. Developer is making good improvements to it too.
Best for learning kanji, perfect features 👍

Very educational and very good kanji app. I've never ever regret that I brought the premium version. Future request: In the dictionary please add separate menu like if we choose words menu then it shows us common to uncommon words, and not by just typing the exact words. And I do have another request if possible, please add common to uncommon phrases. Thank you so much and I hope this feature is added soon😊
replyContent: Hello, and thanks for your review. :) I have some ideas for improving the dictionary, but they're going to have to wait until I've got the iOS version out.

content: Updating to 5 stars after a great dev response, the app has been a great help to my kanji study, I used to do it with a notebook but I save so much time (and paper) using this app, not to mention I can pull out my phone and practice kanji any time I like. I really love the option to study by grade rather than JLPT too. Only other request would be to be able to switch the English words to Japanese (hiragana only of course) in the recognition by meaning section.
replyContent: It's kinda supposed to be like that, to make you not want to make any mistakes.  But, okay.  I'll add user-specified sound effects to the to-do list.

content: Please, help me with a problem. Every time I upload my scores to google drive I see "Failed". What can I do to change that?
replyContent: Hello.  Regrettably, I had to abandon the Google Drive integration because of insurmountable problems.  The good news is it's been replaced with my own dedicated server, which is now up and running.  You should be able to backup/restore your files without issue now.

content: Updates made it snail slow, but it's got wi and we on the hiragana so I can forgive it.
replyContent: You can turn the morphs off in the Game Options screen. I shall track fps performance, and maybe pop up a dialogue or something.

content: Can you take a look at the user list functionality (or at least add some documentation on how to make it work well) - I've been very frustrated by it. I've added custom lists, so that I can add words to different lists based on categories, but I can't seem to control which list the word is added to with any kind of consistency. And words also frequently disappear from my custom lists in between app usage. The Default List also never populates even though I have the options checked.
replyContent: Wow, so it does!  I'll get that fixed in the next version.  Thanks for getting in touch.

content: Perfect all-in-one app for learning Japanese.

The app is amazing but im having a huge problem that i also had in the free version. After learning some new words, those that I did not know are added to the default user list. Sometimes, after a certain period of time, those words are removed from the default list. For example, i just learned 20 new words and had them automatically added to the default list, then went to rate the app, updated it, and now they are gone.
replyContent: There are two options which control when things get automatically added to or removed from the default user list, you can find them in the Options page.  The second one removes items once you've scored 10/10 in the relevant game.  Could that be what's happening?

content: Update removed english meanings in the writing section! And no more possible to reset scores! ???
replyContent: Of course they weren't removed, there was simply a problem with the label colours in that one button in the whole app. Anyway, it's fixed in version 8.8.1 which is rolling out now. The scores reset button was hidden at the last minute, due to an issue which cropped up in testing. It's being fixed now too.

content: Ended up go with pro
replyContent: Thank you for your support  :)

content: You're a god. I love being able to customize my experience through colour schemes. The only thing thats missing is an SRS feature. Maybe as a seperate game that combines the other 3 games? For example you could start with the 3 main games and it would just add what you went through onto the SRS which could update accordingly through its own count of when and how often smth was reviewed. Right now "if smth hits 10 i'll never see it again" which makes it hard to review efficiently while learning.

Great app for learning kanji! Feature request: after you've finished learning a list to 100% and want to review you have to go through the predefined list order or shuffle. Instead, allow sorting by the number of times you've guessed it correctly, reversed (or similar). This way you don't have to review the 1000+ word lists all at once. Edit: thanks for the update, sorry I had missed the option! New colour schemes are great now.
replyContent: See the "Show Dictionary After Wrong Answer" checkbox, in the game options screen.  Other complaints being worked on.

content: I usually don't do app ratting ,but this app deserved it. It is a true learning app and not like many of those commercial apps that doesn't really teach like duilengo for example. I really recommend this app especially for self learners(like myself) in addition to having a Japanese grammer book or app. I really liked the last update and the background color change(thanks guys). There is one feature (if added) would make this application THE APP for learning Japanese( adding the kana alphabet)
replyContent: Thanks for your kind words.  I added kana to the Recognition and Writing games in a recent release, but forget which version number.  It's only me, by the way, this is a solo effort.  :)

content: I really love the latest update! It made me excited again to practice because of the new look, with the colors and now it has a 'practice' option writing the kanji. This really helped a lot in familiarization! Thank you for always upgrading for the best and convenience of the learners. I love this app so much!
replyContent: I'm glad you like it.  The practice button came from discussions with a user, who had a lot of helpful ideas.  I really appreciate constructive feedback like that.

content: Very nice app. Would love to have a feature to turn off the different colors in a kanji since that is a bit distracting. Otherwise fantastic! Thanks for responding so quickly! 5 stars!
replyContent: See the Hint slider, in the game's Options screen.

content: Hands down the best app of it's kind I've found! Especially the updates to the writing. They were very jarring initially, but with the updates, it's a much better experience.

Made with love. Kanji Tree Pro is a technically well made, custom (not of the shelf) and very useful app. Fun to learn an abnormal and horrible language that I really like. I used the free in the past but upgraded to support the dev. The Pro has surprisingly useful features, like voice. For those Japanese learners who are struggling with reading the real stuff, the 5$ are a good investment.
I don't even really need the extras on the pro version but this app is really good so I got pro anyway to support it.
replyContent: Thanks for your support  :)

content: Great app for learning Kanji, highly recommended! The Pro version is definitely worth the money and helps support the developer.
Love this app. It's a basic MC flashcard app. The primary focus is on recognition of meaning, but it also has readings, words, and writing practice. Simple, elegant, and effective
It is a very good app, i love all the features and how you can look up pretty much any word in its dictionary!
The previous issue with User Lists has been fixed, making this a solid Japanese study aid.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app since I retired due to ill health last year.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes all known issues in the user lists.  Please give that a try.

content: I bought this app because so far, it's the only that has offered a feature to study vocabulary whose kanji you already know. I'm just kinda bummed that there's no option to create my own list in the recognition game. It was the reason why I bought it in the first place. So for now, I'll just refund this and install later when the feature comes. I'm looking forward to it.

As I mentioned on ny review for the non-pro version, this app os phenomenal. It takes you through everything you need to learn and expand on your vocabulary. My only qualm is that there is no way to use the system on-screen keyboard in the dictionary and you have to use the app's keyboard. Edit, 2020-05-12: if I could give the app six stars I would. It's possible to use your phone keyboard in the dictionary now! Thank-you!!

Thank you for the update -- back up to 5 stars! As i said before: the best kanji and word learning app i've come across (and I've got a good 50+ japanese learning apps) but this is the one i come back to again and again, especially when searching for new words in the excellent dictionary that has been provided. You will need to learn kana (elsewhere) first, but this is the best post-kana, kanji word learning app (thank you, user lists!) that'll motivate you to tackle grammar (elsewhere) later.
replyContent: All the data's still in there for the advanced kentei, it's just the UI got nobbled accidentally and will be back imminently. In my defence, it was in beta for almost a week and nobody else noticed either. User word lists haven't gone, they've been moved inside the sandbox because access to the public shared directory has been deprecated by Google.

content: Data lost if one upgrades to Pro version. Am very upset
replyContent: The Free and Pro versions are technically two separate apps, so cannot see each other's data. You need to share the Free version's data. I'm currently rewriting the system which does that, to use Google Drive. Hopefully it should be ready soon.  (They're in beta now, and will be live as soon as I've confirmed they're working)

content: I loved the free version of this app so much that I decided to pay for the Pro version. I've used WaniKani and KanjiGarden, but those cost over $100 for lifetime purchase and they lack some features I enjoy from Kanji Tree, such as including ALL the readings and giving ALL examples of each reading, writing tests, and more extensive vocabulary/reading tests with ONLY the kanji you already know. A measly $6 is more than worth it for this app. Thanks!!

Was under the impression that user lists would allow me to create custom lists for the recognition game so that I could learn the difference between kanji that look very similar. There wasn't even a custom user list option on the recognition game. Will gladly buy again if this is added as I've refunded this app.
replyContent: Oh, I see.  I shall be adding more difficulty levels for the Pro version, so the candidates it shows you are visually similar.  I will also see about adding user list support to the recognition game.  It shouldn't be too difficult.

content: Amazing app for memorizing kanji!
I can see results and it's easy to use

Has some quirky issues since the last update, the Advanced Kentei and Common Names stuff were gone with the previous update but it's back when I'm studying today. For me, still the best kanji learning app out there.
The lists work great and the app is a great way to practice writing kanji. I can now honestly say that there is a reason to buy this app over the free version.
replyContent:
Hello.  The user lists have been fixed in version 8.0.x onwards, which was uploaded yesterday.

Also, the Pro version was originally created because people wanted a way to donate money.  It was originally identical to the Free one, but I've added features to it over time, since I don't have to keep it so light.

content: Latest update causes App to crash. Please please fix....... Review updated......working again. Back to one of the best Kanji Apps in the store. Thanks for the fix on my old Galaxy tab......👍👍
replyContent: Fixed version went live earlier today.  Please let me know if you still have any issues

content: I absolutely love the app, but I'm not too amused with the new update. My study list is now gone (RIP), and the app no longer advertises alternative readings of the words either. Consider 私 - it really helps to know that わたくし is an additional reading i must memorise, and that I'm not going crazy and misremembering it as わたし(or vice versa). I consider that a pretty vital feature for learning a language like Japanese.
replyContent:
Can you get in touch by email please?  I think the study list might be recoverable, and at any rate I'd like to investigate what happened.

I noticed the alt readings have gone too; they'll be back in the next version.

content: Amazing!!! Thanks a lot for all your support, I'll let all of my friends know about your app. Great job!
replyContent: I just uploaded version 8.1.0, which contains a fix for the dictionary issue you mentioned.  Please let me know if you notice anything else untoward.

content: All issues are now fixed! Custom User Lists make this app the BEST kanji learning app out there! I highly recommend it to anyone. Dear Developer, thank you so much for fixing the issue. I LOVE this app and am so happy I can now use it fully. Thank you! I hope you are well and am very sorry to hear you had health issues. Wish you the best.
replyContent: Hello, I put out a new version yesterday with fixes for this feature.  Apologies for the very late response, I retired due to ill health so hadn't worked on this app for almost a year.

content: Asked for tech 2/24/20. No response.

Dont buy pro. Waste of money. Amazing app but the pro doesn't add anything and it has problems that were mentioned here many times. The developer isn't answering my email anyway... Even though I think we all demand a refund.
replyContent:
Originally, the Pro version was only intended as a means for people to donate, but I added some extra features to it over time since I didn't have to keep it so lightweight as the free one.

Anyway, v8.1.0 is now up, which should fix all your issues.

content: Great app, one of the best to study kanjis in a daily basis. Sadly I wish the premium version would have an option to see readings and meaning at the same time. Also the kanji stroke order would be nice too. Sometimes I know the kanji but I'm no sure about all the readings or the stroke order ...
replyContent: The writing game shows and teaches you the stroke order, it's not relevant in the other games.

content: I started using the app this month and developed my kanji reading skills faster than I had over a year of study. While the app isn't 100% on every possible thing, I used the free version and wanted to support the dev by getting the pro version. Kinks and bugs can be fixed. However, ease of use, stroke order and meanings can be difficult and I think the dev has done a great job.
I bought pro version for the self made user list feature, which is not working. Would be easy 5 stars otherwise :(
replyContent: Hello, sorry for the late reply.  I uploaded new versions with fixes for the user lists, anything after 8.0.x has no known bugs in it.

content: Crashes when you try to have the Kanji read to you. Immediately refunded.
replyContent: This is fixed in v8.1.0 onwards.  Thanks for getting in touch.

content: I really liked the free app but I ran into a limitation: the lists offered in Recognition and Reading aren't the same, meaning once I recognize all the individual kanji in N5, I can't simply go to Reading, list N5 and learn the readings as the lists don't coincide. I understand why they don't and it's not an issue but I wished there was a way to add kanji in bulk to a user list. I tried this version, but the user list feature requires you search for individual kanji and add them one at a time.
replyContent: The user lists are plain text files, you can edit them with a PC.  It's easy to do if you connect your phone via USB cable.  I'll write up more detailed instructions into the manual when I get some time.

content: The voice function is completely broken. Such a waste.
replyContent: What do you mean?

content: Hey man, if you'd add a "try again" option in the writing game after 3 false tries (instead of just pressing the "okay" button) that'd be great and I'd give 5 stars for that. For now it's 4 stars. Thanks
replyContent: If you tried again immediately then the information would be in your short term memory, so you wouldn't be learning.  It takes 30 to 40 seconds to be evicted from that area, which is why it asks you other questions in the meantime.  That way, you will only get it right if it's in your long term memory.  Which is to say; you've learned it.

content: Especially great for learning words

Like others have said, the custom lists do not work. You cannot actually add any words to a list you create. New lists and folders are also not saved when you leave the menu. Furthermore, it would be ideal for there to be an option to use the phone's native/primary keyboard for searching kanji and words. Finally, I believe the audio function (at least the text-to-speech) could be present in the free version as well, as other apps have done as well, since listening is considered vital.
replyContent:
Hello.  User lists have been fixed in v8.0.x onwards.

The Android keyboard is very buggy when trying to integrate with non-Android apps like Kanji Tree (a multi-platform OpenGL native C++ program).  That said, it's gotten a lot more stable in the year or so since I took it out, so I'm going to add an option to let people use it again.

content: This is the only complete resource for learning Kanji that doesn't gouge your wallet. Pros •Its cheap (and worth it) •No ridiculous paywalls •Readings •No lockout timers •No absurd mnemonics (you can make your own in the notes) •Built in dictionary •Keeps track of kanji you've learned and a rough estimate of how well based on your own rating •Pro version is cheap Cons •Interface takes a minute to get used to •Sometimes, in the breakdown section of a kanji, radicals will not display properly
replyContent: Thanks very much for your kind words  :)

content: I think the free version is great, it gives you a chance to flash card yourself with multi choice! I just bought the pro version....I need help with pronunication I hope it helps. Will update this review after I try out the pro version for a couple of days.

I really like kanji tree pro and use it several times a day. The options for learning or revising are great and the tracking of how often you are correct, and the % tracking are great encouragement. No annoying notifications, yay. Recognition, reading, and writing categories are obviously all important, thanks for having them all. Sound is great, maybe a couple of "wa" vs "ha" errors. My suggestion would be to have the most common readings learnt first, and maybe identify as onyomi and kunyomi.

Bought pro for the speech which is very finicky and broken, if you want to hear it you have to go several taps deep rather than giving you the most common reading, and if you hit the speak button on writing it crashes, just straight up nopes.
replyContent: There isn't any "most common reading" that my native speaking friends can agree on.  Indeed, some kanji don't have any reading.  You're thinking about it wrong.

content: I love this app. It is incredibly helpful and greatly helps me learn to recognize and use kanji. Some of the best features on this app include its writing and reading section. Through doing writing it becomes much easier to remember each kanji in my opinion. Through doing the reading it helps me learn vocabulary and see how the kanji act with hiragana and katakana. Definitely would highly recommend this app, duolingo, and jsho for anyone wanting to learn Japanese.
Replaces all my vocabulary books for very cheap. I'm glad I found this app.
Perfect.
Free version is fine but user lists don't work on paid. Wanted to study alongside my class.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app for a few months.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes all known issues in the user lists.  Please give that a try.

userName: harper void HV ハーパー
content: すごい 私は漢字が好きです、でも 僕はヒラガナとカタカナが嫌いです。 Over all a great app :) Must play
Bought it for the personal lists. Whenever I created a list, the list with the words I added vanished. Didn't find a way to get them back or use them.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app for a few months.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes all known issues in the user lists.  Please give that a try.

content: You deserve every penny mate.

This is by far my favorite app for studying Japanese! The best part is that it focuses on learning via kanji radicals. It has both frequencies of different readings and lists of words that use each reading. Everything is a simple tap away: you can tap your way through the radicals to understand what each one means, or tap through the readings and see all the relevant words. It also has a feature to practice drawing and integration with Takoboto so you can easily see example sentences. I even bought the pro version because this was so much better than other study apps. Would highly recommend!

Very useful app to learn japanese writing! There are some issues related to text to speech not working. The soloution is that a setting in your phone's settings must be set. preffered text to speech engine must be set to google text to speech. On samsung it is defaulted to samsung which is why you don't get any sound. Open your device's Settings app  Select Accessibility, then Text-to-speech (output). Choose your google's text to speech engine.
I really like this app but the personal kanji list does not seem to work at all... I can't add any kanjis to my list, not to mention that my list always disappears... Please fix this.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app since I retired due to ill health last year.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes all known issues in the user lists.  Please give that a try.

content: a very great app for learning kanji, i only have a few issues with a few bugs i noticed. first, when i clear the cached data of the app or stop running the app in the background, my word list get deleted. second when running the app in shared screen with youtube, the sound stop working even after stopping the shared screen and i need to reboot the phone to have the sound back. The app crash every time I try to put a word in my user list. The previous problems still persist too.
Best App for learning Kanji, I have tried a few, I study between games instead of Instragram.
Are you able to make the app read out the kanji as it shows up, then again if we get it right or wrong?

awful sound effects you can't turn off. No way to get the audio of the pronunciations (crucial to effective learning) without also getting an extremely loud buzzer whenever you mark a word as not yet known (which by amplifying negative feedback is fatal to effective learning).

The free version is awesome. All the features of the paid version are broken or really suck. The custom keyboard is just terrible. The sound effects are really annoying. The text to speech is a gimmick at best. The devs really need to work on different aspects for the paid version and at least make the things they want to sell work. Wait for a major update before paying.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app since I retired due to ill health last year.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes all known issues in the user lists.

The Android keyboard is buggy when interoperating with native OpenGL apps, but it's more stable recently so I'll add an option to use it.

content: 10/10, would support awesome developers again. Could we get a way to sync progress across devices?

Got the pro version so I could make my own user lists. The feature is broken. If I would have read others reviews I could have not lost my money. I'll update if the developer ever fixes it. Right now this is the same as the free version but with audio.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app since I retired due to ill health last year.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes all known issues in the user lists.  Please give that a try.

content: there is no question that kanji tree is one of the best apps for learning kanji. i find free version the best. after paying for this paid version i couldn't find it additionally useful. i request devs to provide a way copy kanji/words to clipboard so that i can search it somwhere else instead of typing it
The app itself is great for leading the Kanji, however when I installed the Pro version, so I could listen to the words, it crashed everytime I pressed the speaker button.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app since I retired due to ill health last year.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes your issues.  Please give that a try.

content: I paid for this app to support the developer and there have been no regrets. Without this app, I would know far less Japanese for sure. I enjoy using my stylus to write the Kanji. The app is so beautifully crafted. Simple, yet still has the feel of a one-person project at the same time. The example sentences give you plenty of practice material to work with. It's been a year and a half since I first discovered this app, and I have still spent hours using it and learning. I recommend this over WaniKani, which is unreasonably pricy!

it's great! I thought the free version was so useful that I paid for the pro version after about 2 days was all so I could contribute to the developer. It took several tries and minutes but once I found the menu option I was able to upload my history from the free version with no glitches.
ok..

The best free kanji app hands down. There is no reason to pay unless you like hearing things spoken, or you want to support the developer. I got the paid version because there should be more developers like this guy.
I'm buying to support the app. People will complain about the UI but the app isn't a triple-A game, its a very effective learning tool. The simpler the better

There are few apps for which you would never hesistate to pay even if not asked and this is the one of them .Elegant .Simple. Crystal clear.That is all that describes the experience of the app .It gives you repetitve learning which makes you to remember kanji very easiy and interface is so so so smooth .Kudos to developer .Very few have been left of your lot .All others are money making or ad delivery machines not study apps .❤👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽 .But money should gobto right place and that is here.
The app is nice, it's good for learning. However i purchased the pro version and i couldn't hear a single sound. That's a pity, got refunded straight away.
Beautifully designed app!!
完璧です

Very poor. It is a very good app in the standard form but the Pro version failed to open on every attempt so I requested a refund. Hope the issue is resolved as it would have been a good improvement on an already good app.

A really good app for kanji study. However, I got the pro version for the 'custom user lists' function which I expected to be the ability to create kanji lists to match the lessons in my kanji books. It turns out that this functionality is actually just the ability to flag particular kanji and have a list of those. Useful if that's what you're after, but not what I was expecting to get, so I'm sticking with the free version.
replyContent:
Hello, sorry for the slow response.  I haven't been working on this app since I retired due to ill health last year.

Anyway, there's a new version out yesterday which fixes all known issues in the user lists.  Please give that a try.

content: I bought this app because I wanted to hear the words spoken. I have done as instructed but for some reason when I click into the words I can't hear them. I've checked my sound settings and that's not the problem. Very disappointed considering the cost. May well uninstall
I will like to have the sound of each kanji in the writting mode
paid for the voice but it just kept crashing.real shame as it seems really good otherwise.

Could not get audio to work, tried multiple tts but nothing solved it,(that includes the recommended ones, and im able to use tts in other apps) making peronal lists needs better UX, the free version is really good and I really love it and I wish i could get the audio to work but had to get a refund. I hope the developer is able to come up with a better integration for the audio I will try this paid version again in the future but right now to myself the paid version offers nothing.
Just installed the pro version and it exits every time I try to do something in the app. See you when it works. Next app please!

I really like this app, so I had to get this version to contribute to it. I find the audio quite helpful, as I also remember things better when listening to the words. Sometimes there are audio mistakes and sounds quite computerized, but overall it's a feature I really like. This app has helped me so much to learn kanjis in words I am very grateful for its existance. It's like a game, so it's much fun. Together with the Kanji Study App I am making my way towards the JLPT N2. Thanks a lot :) !

Nothing useful included works as expected. Creating new lists is either broken, or very difficult. I was hoping to be able to create sub-lists from the larger groups by selecting kanji and kanji words with a single tap each. I consider myself pretty decent with tech, and was unable to add any words to any list, or rename lists or folders. (The base app features are still very good though)

This app was great. Fantastic. Everything I could have asked for, worth the money. And then this update came around that added a new keyboard. The new keyboard sucks, just please let me use my regular old Google keyboard. Also it added its own copy/paste buttons to the dictionary, and they just straight up don't work. This app is really nice, but just wait until they fix it before shelling out the money.

Love this app, a perfect tool for studying my kanji for Japanese class! Thank you developer for such an amazing product, and I hope the feedback helps! Edit: A recent update deleted all of my chapter study lists, so I had to remake them all again :/ It was rather upsetting, and was time consuming to recreate. But, without this app I would not be doing as well with my Kanji, so I will only add the note here that you need to back up your lists to somewhere else!!
replyContent: You can organise the files/directories using your PC.  Connect via USB cable, and look in the phone's Documents folder.

content: good app... in previous version have option to choose keyboard..i used handwriting keyboard...but now i can't use handwriting keyboard.. i want that option back...

I bought this to support the developer as the free version was really useful. However, the main issue I found was that I am unable to add any user-defined lists. The keyboard is very bulky as well because it does not allow for 3rd party keyboards. I will increase the rating once these issues are fixed.

I loved the free version of this app. And this app WOULD be great too, but it won't let me actually edit any user defined lists. I can "create" a list, but when I click "add words" and do a search, there is no way to actually add the word to the list. I downloaded this app to practice writing specific kanji and words, but I can't do that without this feature =/ Also, lack of third party keyboard support is a major downside. Makes searching a lot more tedious.

When I press back, it goes back to the first screen instead of going back once... I'll give 4 stars for rating because the app good overall but I want a refund as this is far too inconvenient for me...

I've given 5 stars and written a full review for the free app which is essentially the same minus the audio. The pro version doesn't access the user data from the free version so any progress made while using the free app is lost, you have to start from the beginning. This is one serious issue that should be easy to fix. 1 star deducted until this is fixed.  I bought the pro app to support the developer, and I don't need the audio, so I guess I'm OK with this either way. I'll just keep using the free version for now.
This is a really good app for those who want to learn Japanese (kanji). Believe me it's really help you a lot and worth buying it.
very good. using it a lot. helps me prioritise what to learn
how to import data from free version? update: easy stuff. push it from the settings in the free version.

I like this app, but the user created list feature is broken for me. I can create a new list, but when I go in to add words, they don't appear in the list, and when I exit the list, the list has disappeared from my list of lists.

This is the best Kanji app I've used. The writing practice tool alone is fantastic. I've recommended the base version to tons of people and just got the Pro version. The dev has been great with responding to feedback and bugs, which is a big part of why I went for the Pro version. Everything I've found to fix he has worked to fix and he has added lots of features.
The best app to learn kanji.

Absolutely wonderful app. I bought to support the creator. This app perfectly does in one app, what I have been trying to accomplish with many others. I thought it was only going to be kanji, but the moment I saw vocab for JLPT tests and how nicely it was broken down I told myself "yup we are buying this one". I wish I found this ages ago, as it would have made studying so much easier and less time wasted trying to blend all my study materials together.
dictinary doesn't work.

Worked great until I tried making my own kanji list. Finding single kanji characters is a nightmare、and searching for each one I want to add one at a time is super slow and clunky. Being able to select multiple from the main lists and add them all at once、or at least being able to go into a multi part kanji (sensei、ichinen、etc.) and add the individual parts would make this app so much better.

I'm seeing alot of great reviews for this app and at first, I was thinking that I was going it wrong but after some research I found that I wasn't, so what's the deal then? I was doing the tutorial then it sends me to the grade 1 page and it's not giving me descriptions or meanings yet, it's asking me for the meaning and everything I tap I get a red X because it's wrong. But of course it's wrong, you never showed me the meaning. Bah, whatever, I'm goin back to America and gettin a cheeseburger!
replyContent: If you don't know, then tap the kanji itself and it will show you.  Also, don't worry about getting it "wrong" the first time, just try to get it right the next time.  :)

content: I bought this because I already used the free version and it's good! I want to support you. By the way, is there cloud syncing in this version? (and I suggest add feature "history" in the dictionary)
This app has been very helpful in helping me recgonize kanji. User interface is nicely set up and easy to use. If you are trying to learn kanji this is a great app to aid in your studies.

I've needed this app for 30 years. I've been living in Japan for over half my life. I can read just fine but I can't write at all. I fill out forms by typing into my phone and copying the characters with my embarrassing chicken scratch penmanship. For weeks I've been waking up in the early hours of the morning and teaching myself how to write properly. I can't thank you enough for all the effort you put into this app. Please add hiragana & katakana or make a separate app. I like the 書き方 feature

I just bought it to support the creator (I thibk it's such a good app!) and because in this version you can hear the pronunciation :) Still discovering the app in general. Mostly I use the 'Reading' section and absolutely love it. Very easy to remember this way as it brings up the words you had difficulty with to the front. I use this app together with Kanjidic, which is also a great app for writing Kanji.
Wonderful app. It's been very helpful for me.

There was a lot of confusion getting text to speech working. I realize this is not part of Kanji Tree. However, Kanji Tree settings just say to make sure TTS is installed. That is not enough. Some clarification would have saved a lot.of grief.

I recently got the free version of this app. Best kanji learning app, period. It was so great and you get every single full feature, without ads or anything. I wanted to buy this version just to show my appreciation. If you don't believe me, get the free version and see for yourself!
Love the app and its worth the money.

The app is great, the writing feature especialy helps you remember the characters. This pro version may seem confusing at first, but you can customise everything to your liking. It also has a voice feature which is great! Really cheap as well, considering the amount you learn from it.
Great app, but please, for the love of god change those failing sounds. I'd still like to hear them but the sounds you are using honestly are terrible!
This app is amazing. Easily the best way to learn the Kanji.
Astoundingly well designed. I used many other kanji apps before - this one is on a completely different level.

Tried to persevere with this but it's just too buggy and counter intuitive to be useful. It takes ages to set up user lists manually and then frequently you'll find all the words have gone to another list because the wrong box was ticked in the previous screen. Sometimes you can't input anything. Sometimes when you edit the title of a list it will hang in your screen until you restart the app. There's no way to alter the strictness of reviews or set it to manual. Etc etc

This app is super solid. I love the breakdown of the kanji and it works super well in conjunction with a few other resources I've been using. I still cant manage the audible pronunciation on the app, but I am really enjoying the ease of use. 100% worth it for me. Looking forward to a time when my audio works. (if there is some secret please let me know)

Incredibly useful application, but with a mediocre UI. It would be more user friendly if it allowed us to split the app lists and custom lists into smaller parts for easier studying, and if we could create custom lists more easily (by importing from other apps like Takoboto, and having the "add-to-the-list star" that words have on the kanji too when we click on them). Also, the icons, the buttons and pretty much everything about the interface could be improved to look more modern and appealing.
perfect except for a few errors in pronunciation
replyContent:
I've had innumerable reports of errors in the dictionary, but so far the dictionary has been proven correct every time.  :)

If you're sure you've found a mistake, but all means let me know though.

content: The free app is the best kanji learning app I've ever used. The learning method is simple and effective. I wanted to support its development and so bought this version. The really annoying thing though is that I dont have a way of carrying over my progress from the free app! I wish there was a way to link the two versions so that I can copy over progress and my personal lists.
audio doesn't work
replyContent: A few people do have difficulty setting it up, but I can assure you it does work.  Please see Options->Speech, and if that still doesn't work then please do get in touch via email.  andrew.sj.innes@gmail.com

content: Wonderful app, been trying to get back into learning Japanese for a while, this app made the experience fun again. Very happy to support the developer, excellent work, keep it up.

Great app! I already left a review on the free app but shall add here (I run out of charcters you see) that the Kanji drill-down into the radicals feature is, well, Sugoi desu yo! Motto arigatou gozaimashita 😁
Great app. I just can't get the TTS text-to-speech functionality to work. And, it is configured correctly.
replyContent: Have you checked it in the Reading Game?  Sometimes people get confused about how it works with kanji, as opposed to words.

content: Easy effective training to match your kanji goals

Hey I really love this app and learning Japanese in English is fine and all, but I'd like to try it out in german since my first language is German. So in the settings I tried to select german as language but nothing changed ^^'' does the german version not exist yet or is there a trick I'm not doing right? 😂(or a bug?)
Great app, has helped me so much learning kanji. I have been using it for months. Great support as well!
replyContent: I forgot to mention, this was fixed last weekend.  Sorry about that.

content: Great app to practice writing kanji! 一番のアプリ！

This app is great, was using the free version previously and decided to pay for this version too as it's so good. Has really helped my kanji learning over and above the flash cards and apps I was using previously
App is very useful. There are some bugs but core features are very useful
replyContent: People often have difficulty with that.  First, make sure your *Media* volume is up.  The volume buttons normally affect the Ringtone by default.  If that doesn't work, then try to get it working in another app.  Try to get your browser to read a webpage to you.  If that works, Kanji Tree will work too.

content: Five stars! The best app I have found that teaches Kanji. Bought the full version to support the maker. Teaches you in a very effective way that really suits my style of learning. Love the "hints" that show you what other kanji make up the new ones you are learning, for example the kanji for "east" is made up of the kanji for "wood" and "day". Really love that little detail!
Great app for kanji learning
Best ever!!
I bought this to help study and create multiple lists to study from. It's a great app I suggest it to everyone in my Japanese language classes.
Best app I've found for kanji. The only complaints I have are about some scoring algorithms, but hopefully they will improve in time
Worth every cent to support this amazing app. It is an absolutely great kanji tutor!
Read my review on the free variant ; purchased to support the development
Just brilliant. Downloaded free version but wanted to donate to support fabulous work so paid up. If you want to learn Japanese reading look no further. So useful and so fun.
Nice learning system.
Functional all in one solution for kanji learning.

i'd love to see the different languages added in, hope it gets finished soon (the language switcher is allready in place) great app, really lets you find out more about kanji, their origin and what parts they are made of
Perfect, the best way to learn kanji. It is all i can ask for. Congratulations!
I am so impressed with a free version that I bought the paid version at once.

Exceptional app for learning readings and basic recognition, probably the best. I don't think it has the right idea for teaching writing though - there should be an option for it to guide you through each kanji and immediately ask you to reproduce it. Currently, if you get the stroke order wrong (which will happen EVERY time if you're a beginner and using this app to learn), it shows you the right order very quickly and then immediately moves on to another kanji, and by the time you get to try it again, you've completely forgotten how to write it. Somewhat nitpicky given how fantastic the other features of this app are, but I feel that the writing section is very ineffective because of this one reason. Absolutely would recommend for an learner of kanji. It is so good it's essential.

Functionality bugs have been fixed. Only remaining gripe is that I still get crashes in launch. Frequently have to launch it 2 to 3 times to get it to load correctly. Other than that I love the app. -edit The free version runs flawlessly.
replyContent: I'm seeing one bizarre crash on huawei devices.  There's three devices affected, all from huawei.  In still scratching my head at the moment, and will let you know if I figure anything out.  Does the free version crash?

content: I love the way this app was designed and it really meshes well with how I learn, so I decided to support you by buying Pro. My only issue at the moment is that I can't seem to get the TTS to work despite installing everything and setting Google TTS as default in my phones language and input settings.
replyContent: Does TTS work in other apps?  Try to get it to read a webpage to you from your browser.

content: Simple interface, not really any clutter, and lots of customization options for the learning experience. Can't really put my finger on why i like it better than other apps, but it does its job well. Upgraded to bonus version to support author. :)
Best app for studying kanji and words together

I wanted to support your development, so I got the pro version. The cloud backup is an important feature and the link to takoboto is a nice addition as well. I only wish that it would have been possible to import my progress from the normal kanji tree app. Maybe you can think of an import/export feature for the upgrading?
replyContent: This is out now.  It was in beta for a while, then in staged roll out, and I set it to 100% about an hour ago

content: Best Japanese app, practical and clean👍
Easily the best study aid for written Japanese. Has everything. Look no further. Seriously.
Installed this version too, tried and found perfect. Thank you. 😃
I loved the free version so I purchased the pro upgrade. Unfortunately this version crashes every time I try to open it. Am I doing something wrong?
replyContent: A couple of people have reported the same thing, but I only see one crash report in the developer console.  It's related to checking for Text-To-Speech support.  I've fixed that bug now, and have just released a new version.

content: The premium version is worth the money.
Awesome app, makes learning to write kanji so much fun, I can barely stop playing ^_^

Amazing kanji learning app. Makes learning fun and easy! Would love to be able to turn off the "potential answers" in the games to force me to have to think of the meaning without having it in front of me (I cover it with my hand at the moment). 5 stars for your hard work!

You didn't put ads in the free version, which alone is almost enough to make me want to support you. Your easy to use app that's surprisingly addictive is what pished me to. Now I have an app in Japanese and one in English

This is the best app for learning kanji. The recognition game helps you learn each of the meanings super fast. You can also change its format to help you learn its readings. Then you can test your ability to read in the designated reading game. And then learn to write each. It truly is very helpful. I learned more from this app in a few months than I did by myself in a year. The developer is also super open to feedback. This app is definitely worth investing in.

I ve been testing a lot of japanese learning app, so far this is the best for learning app , look no further this is your best app for learning japanese, fyi there is a minor bug on recognition, practice drawing will change to 5 stars after bug fix
replyContent: Yeah, I noticed that yesterday too.  I screwed up the layout during the recent UI refresh.  I'll get it fixed soon but I'm on vacation right now so it won't be immediate

content: The best kanji app there is, and one of the best apps of any kind I've ever seen. The writing recognition is a real game changer, and you can organize practice by JLPT level, so I had to support it. Only two things that would be nice, a writing practice for the kana (even though they aren't kanji), and a way to test JPLT words in kana (just for the purpose of the test). Just a fantastic app though.
Best kanji app made better. The only missing feature is a way to import progress from the free version :(
Upgraded to premium to get the benefits of audio and also to show my support. This app has taught me more than any other app and I use it every day!

Finally a version where we get to thank you for your incredible work! This app has everything I could ask for in a Kanji learning app, from user-defined lists to actual practice writing the kanji, with a wonderfully simple grading mechanism. The only thing I could even think of that you could add would be an additional search method in the dictionary, drawing the kanji and searching that way, like the KanjiVG Project. But that's a superfluous function in an app that does all you need, all you want, and more. An excellent choice, and should be the first choice for anyone wanting to start learning Japanese!
replyContent:
Thank you very much for your kind words.

I've yet to find any software which implements that feature you mentioned in a satisfactory manner, so I assume it's a lot more difficult than it would appear.  I doubt very much I could improve on their efforts, but as an engineer, of course I'm curious to try.  :)

content: A great app, now with voice!
Still great. Love it. Can't wait for cloud sync because I've already lost data twice and frequently switch devices.

User-defined study lists!! Awesome!! That's the one feature I really wanted in Kanji Tree!! The UI interface has been cleaned up too. I used the original (free) Kanji Tree app and loved it so happy to pay for this one to support your work.
Love the app and totally jumped to the chance of getting the pro version.... But please please include an option to turn off the sound effects... They're too distracting for me...
